question:
Doctors should be responsible for educating their patient how to improve their health.
Do you agree with this?
text: Physical issues have become increasingly a major crux among most demographics of this century. Many people believe that it is the obligation  of doctor's and they should teach their patient about health consequences. This essay will discuss why it is crucial to the individual's healthy lives to being aware of their own fitness.

People are mostly trustworthy of getting medico advices. First and foremost, they are unlikely to be in danger with any of their physical illnesses. And also, in many embryonic countries individual's are more likely uneducated and mystified about actual physics. For  example, a recent survey shows that 50% of the citizens in Bangladesh clutching onto a medical advisor for their physical improvement. In addition, physicians welfare can emphasize the fundamental requirements and effective ways for the individual's well being. These few instances can bolster the existing concept that only doctors can't be able to make sure the patients physical enhancement.

However, individuals should have to be mindful and compassionate towards their own energy. First of all, if anyone wants to live a healthy life he or she must have to prevent them from including bad habits such as eating fast food. Moreover, they must have to be informed about the outcomes of their activities. For instance, most of the masses in Japan do not face any major health issues in their lives, because there are taught health related lessons in their schools. Furthermore, the government can, also, proceed some necessary steps by highlighting the catalyst of healthier lives.

In conclusion, this essay discussed alone physicians can't amend the individual's mindset for their own well being. To infer I am convinced that fitness is closely intertwined with enlightening system and people’s lifestyle.
